ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Portuguese 150 is much more of a material-based class than a grammar class. It's mostly about Brazilian culture and history during the period of the dictatorship, and includes movies and some popular songs from the era. You do very little formal grammar, just some review of main points that you should have learned in lower levels, and focus on learning through the texts. The amount of work is not excessive, just make sure that you space out the essays properly or you will have a ton of stuff to hand in during the last week of class. When you choose the book that you want to present about, make sure that you find it interesting because you will spend a lot of time reading it.
Take this class if you're really interested in learning about contemporary Brazilian history. If you've been to Rio, you'll love it
Yes, the course does a good job of presenting advanced material in an interesting manner. It was like taking a short course in modern Brazilian literature and history.
